## Workflow Features

### CI Workflow Features

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Multi-OS Testing** | Tests on Ubuntu, Windows, and macOS |
| **Multi-Version** | Tests with Node.js 20 and 22 |
| **Native Module Support** | Rebuilds better-sqlite3 for each platform |
| **Build Artifacts** | Uploads dist/ for 7 days |
| **Build Verification** | Ensures committed dist/ is up to date |
| **Fast Feedback** | Parallel job execution |

### Release Workflow Features

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **npm Provenance** | Supply chain security attestation |
| **Automated Publishing** | Zero-touch release process |
| **Pre-publish Validation** | Full test suite before publish |
| **Package Verification** | Dry-run before actual publish |
| **Release Summary** | Auto-generated markdown summary |
| **Scoped Package** | Published as `@daichi-kudo/mcp-memory-sqlite` |

## Performance Metrics

| Metric | Typical Value |
|--------|---------------|
| CI Job Duration | 2-3 minutes |
| Release Job Duration | 3-5 minutes |
| Matrix Test Total | 12-18 minutes (6 parallel) |
| npm Publish Time | 30-60 seconds |

## Caching Strategy

Both workflows use npm caching to speed up installations:

```yaml
- uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  with:
    node-version: '20'
    cache: 'npm'  # â† Caches node_modules based on package-lock.json
```

This reduces dependency installation time from ~60s to ~10s.
